title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 October 2008 - XWiki
content:
xwikibot - (17/10/2008 09:57): Applications.TodoApplication was modified by xwiki:XWiki.VincentMassol - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/TodoApplication  
xwikibot - (17/10/2008 12:32): XWiki.admin was modified by XWiki.admin (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/admin  
xwikibot - (17/10/2008 12:41): XWiki.XWikiAllGroup was modified by xwiki:XWiki.RaffaelloPelagalli - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiAllGroup  
xwikibot - (17/10/2008 12:41): XWiki.admin was modified by XWiki.VincentMassol (deleted document) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/admin  
phreeza - (17/10/2008 13:34): hi all, i am trying to map an existing table with a foreign key to an xwiki class... in hibernate I used a <many-to-one> for the field, and in xwiki a database list with a selector. when i try to make an object from the class it does not work. there is a java stacktrace but it doesn't tell me anything helpful.  
phreeza - (17/10/2008 13:35): i guess my question is a) what is the Database List stored as in the db? an integer, or a string, or what? and b) what would a good way to map this existing foreign key to my xwiki?  
phreeza - (17/10/2008 13:51): what does the Relational Storage checkbox mean?  
vmassol - (17/10/2008 13:59): phreeza: sorry I can't answer you. I haven't used database list class yet  
phreeza - (17/10/2008 13:59): vmassol: ok thanks for your reply. I'm going to send the question to xwiki-users, maybe someone there has an idea.  
vmassol - (17/10/2008 14:00): yep  
jvdrean - (17/10/2008 14:00): phreeza  
jvdrean - (17/10/2008 14:00): a) in your mapping file I'd suggest that you stick to simple types like strings  
jvdrean - (17/10/2008 14:01): in xwiki database lists are store as strings in the db  
jvdrean - (17/10/2008 14:01): this type is here to allow you to build a complex "edit displayer" (ie: being able to populate a select input with the result of a hibernate query)  
phreeza - (17/10/2008 14:05): jvdrean: thanks once again for your help. it seems like a very powerful tool. I'll think about whether i can make it work with just strings.  
xwikibot - (17/10/2008 14:21): Main.ReleaseNotes was modified by XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotes  
xwikibot - (17/10/2008 14:22): Main.ReleaseNotes was modified by XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotes

xwikibot - (17/10/2008 14:32): Main.ReleaseNotesXEM14 was modified by XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXEM14  
xwikibot - (17/10/2008 15:46): Main.ReleaseNotesXEM14 was modified by XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXEM14  
vmassol - (17/10/2008 16:01): guys is the build working for you? It's failing for me  
vmassol - (17/10/2008 16:01): thomasmortagne: it's failing on space manager right now  
vmassol - (17/10/2008 16:02): see http://rafb.net/p/n6gZ2775.html  
vmassol - (17/10/2008 16:06): maybe it's because our archiva instance is removing snapshots too quickly (it shouldn't remove them if they're not older than a few days)  
vmassol - (17/10/2008 16:09): running with -U seems to be working  
vmassol - (17/10/2008 16:12): ok now it's the webdav plugin not building  
vmassol - (17/10/2008 16:37): ok got it to build manually but there's definitely a pb  
xwikibot - (17/10/2008 21:58): XWiki.allgrand33 was modified by XWiki.allgrand33 (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/allgrand33
